pasta.web.controller

Class SubmissionController

  • java.lang.Object
    • pasta.web.controller.SubmissionController

  • @Controller
@RequestMapping(value="/")
public class SubmissionController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class for the submission (pretty much other, I just dump everything that didn't fit in the other controllers in here) functions.

    Handles mappings of $PASTAUrl$/...

    Both students and teaching staff can access this url.

    Since:
    2012-11-13
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Alex Radu

      • goBack

        @RequestMapping(value="mirror/")
public java.lang.String goBack(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        $PASTAUrl$/mirror/

        Redirect back to the referrer. This is mainly used to get rid of the resubmitting a form when refreshing a page.

        Parameters:
        request - the http request used for redirection
        session - the http session that is never used here directly, but is passed to other methods to ensure that the binding result information is kept when using the mirror to stop the refreshing may re-submit form.
        Returns:
        redirect to the referrer.

      • home

        @RequestMapping(value="home/")
public java.lang.String home(org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                   javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        $PASTAUrl$/home/

        The home screen. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. ATTRIBTUES:

        unikeythe user object for the currently logged in user
        assessmentsmap of all assessments by category (key of category: String, value of list of Assessment
        resultsThe results as a map (key of short name of assessment: String, value of AssessmentResult
        JSP:
        • user/tutorHome - if the user is a tutor
        • user/studentHome - if the user is a student
        Parameters:
        model - the model being used
        session - the http session that may hold the binding result information.
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "user/tutorHome" or "user/studentHome"

      • submitAssessment

        @RequestMapping(value="home/",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String submitAssessment(@ModelAttribute(value="submission")
                                               Submission form,
                                               org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result,
                                               org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        $PSATAUrl/home/ - POST

        Submit an assessment. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. FAIL CONDITIONS:

        Submission.NoFileThe form doesn't contain a file
        Submission.NotZipThe file is not a zip file (extension of .zip)
        Submission.AfterClosingDateThe submission is past the due date
        Submission.NoAttemptsThere are no attempts left to this user
        If the submission is validated correctly and doesn't encounter any of the fail conditions, it's submitted using SubmissionManager.submit(String, Submission) Then it's redirected to $PASTAUrl$/mirror/ to clear the form submission buffer such that pressing reload has no chance of resubmitting your form.
        Parameters:
        form - the submission form holding the code
        result - the binding result used for feedback
        model - the model being used
        session - the http session used for allowing passing the binding result along while using $PASTAUrl$/mirror/ to redirect and such that you will not resubmit the form if you refresh the page
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "redirect:/mirror/"

      • viewAssessmentInfo

        @RequestMapping(value="info/{assessmentName}/")
public java.lang.String viewAssessmentInfo(@PathVariable(value="assessmentName")
                                                 java.lang.String assessmentName,
                                                 org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        $PASTAUrl$/info/{assessmentName}/

        View the details and history for an assessment. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. ATTRIBUTES:

        unikeyPASTAUser of the user logged in
        assessmentAssessment the assessment
        historyCollection of AssessmentResult for all of the submissions
        nodeListMap of FileTreeNode with the key as the date of the submission and the value being the root node of the code that was submitted.
        JSP:
        • user/viewAssessment
        Parameters:
        assessmentName - the short name (no whitespace) of the assessment
        model - the model being used
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "user/viewAssessment"

      • viewExcel

        @RequestMapping(value="downloadMarks/")
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView viewExcel(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        $PASTAUrl$/downloadMarks/

        Download the marks as an excel sheet. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. If the user is not a tutor: redirect to home.

        Parameters:
        request - the http request that is kinda not used.
        response - also not really used
        Returns:
        the model and view (which is actually a ExcelMarkView)

                                                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        $PASTAUrl$/downloadAutoMarks/

        Download the only the automated marks (all but hand marking) as an excel sheet. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. If the user is not a tutor: redirect to home.

        Parameters:
        request - the http request that is kinda not used.
        response - also not really used
        Returns:
        the model and view (which is actually a ExcelMarkView)

      • updateComment

        @RequestMapping(value="student/{username}/info/{assessmentName}/updateComment/",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String updateComment(@RequestParam(value="newComment")
                                            java.lang.String newComment,
                                            @RequestParam(value="assessmentDate")
                                            java.lang.String assessmentDate,
                                            @PathVariable(value="username")
                                            java.lang.String username,
                                            @PathVariable(value="assessmentName")
                                            java.lang.String assessmentName,
                                            org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        $PASTAUrl$/student/{username}/info/{assessmentName}/updateComment/ - POST

        Update the comment for a given user for a given assessment for a given submission using HandMarkingManager.saveComment(String, String, String, String)

        Parameters:
        newComment - the new comment
        assessmentDate - the assessment date (format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH-mm-ss)
        username - the name of the user
        assessmentName - the short name (no shitespace) of the assessment
        model - the model being used
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "redirect:/home/" or "redirect:../"

      • getFile

        @RequestMapping(value="viewFile/loadFile",
                method=GET)
public void getFile(@RequestParam(value="file_name")
                          java.lang.String fileName,
                          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        $PASTAUrl$/viewFile/loadFile - GET

        View a file. If the user has authenticated and is a tutor, serve up the document, otherwise do nothing. Not sure if it's actually being used

        Parameters:
        fileName - the path to the file.
        response - the http response being used to serve the content

      • viewFile

        @RequestMapping(value="viewFile/",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String viewFile(@RequestParam(value="location")
                                       java.lang.String location,
                                       org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        $PASTAUrl$/viewFile/loadFile - GET

        View a file. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. If the user is not a tutor: redirect to home. ATTRIBUTES:

        unikeyPASTAUser of the currently logged in user
        locationThe location of the disk of the file
        codeStyleThe map of coding styles. Map
        fileEndingThe file ending of the file you're viewing
        fileContentsThe contents of the file, with the > and < escaped
        JSP:
        • assessment/mark/viewFile
        Parameters:
        location - the path to the file location
        model - the model being used
        response - the response that's not really being used
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "redirect:/home/"

      • viewStudent

        @RequestMapping(value="student/{username}/home/")
public java.lang.String viewStudent(@PathVariable(value="username")
                                          java.lang.String username,
                                          org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        $PASTAUrl$/student/{username}/home/

        View the home page for a given user. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. If the user is not a tutor: redirect to home. ATTRIBUTES:

        unikeyPASTAUser for the currently logged in user
        viewedUserPASTAUser for the viewed user
        assessmentsmap of all assessments by category (key of category: String, value of list of Assessment
        resultsThe results as a map (key of short name of assessment: String, value of AssessmentResult
        JSP:
        • user/studentHome
        Parameters:
        username - the name of the user you are looking at
        model - the model being used
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "redirect:/home/" or "user/studentHome"

      • submitAssessment

        @RequestMapping(value="student/{username}/home/",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String submitAssessment(@PathVariable(value="username")
                                               java.lang.String username,
                                               @ModelAttribute(value="submission")
                                               Submission form,
                                               org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result,
                                               org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
        $PASTAUrl$/student/{username}/home/

        Submit an assessment for another user. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. If the user is not a tutor: redirect to home. FAIL CONDITIONS:

        Submission.NoFileThe form doesn't contain a file
        Submission.NotZipThe file is not a zip file (extension of .zip)
        If the submission is validated correctly and doesn't encounter any of the fail conditions, it's submitted using SubmissionManager.submit(String, Submission) Then it's redirected to $PASTAUrl$/mirror/ to clear the form submission buffer such that pressing reload has no chance of resubmitting your form.
        Parameters:
        form - the submission form holding the code
        result - the binding result used for feedback
        model - the model being used
        session - the http session used for allowing passing the binding result along while using $PASTAUrl$/mirror/ to redirect and such that you will not resubmit the form if you refresh the page
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "redirect:/mirror/"

      • downloadAssessment

        @RequestMapping(value="download/{username}/{assessmentName}/{assessmentDate}/")
public void downloadAssessment(@PathVariable(value="username")
                                     java.lang.String username,
                                     @PathVariable(value="assessmentName")
                                     java.lang.String assessmentName,
                                     @PathVariable(value="assessmentDate")
                                     java.lang.String assessmentDate,
                                     org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                     javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
        $PASTAUrl$/download/{username}/{assessmentName}/{assessmentDate}/

        Serve the zip file that contains the submission for the username for a given assessment at a given time. If the user has not authenticated or is not a tutor: do nothing Otherwise create the zip file and serve the zip file. The file name is $username$-$assessmentName$-$assessmentDate$.zip

        Parameters:
        username - the user which you want to download the submission for
        assessmentName - the short name (no whitespace) of the assessment
        assessmentDate - the date (format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH-mm-ss)
        model - the model being used
        response - the http response being used to serve the zip file.

      • runAssessment

        @RequestMapping(value="runAssessment/{username}/{assessmentName}/{assessmentDate}/")
public java.lang.String runAssessment(@PathVariable(value="username")
                                            java.lang.String username,
                                            @PathVariable(value="assessmentName")
                                            java.lang.String assessmentName,
                                            @PathVariable(value="assessmentDate")
                                            java.lang.String assessmentDate,
                                            org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        $PASTAUrl$/runAssessment/{username}/{assessmentName}/{assessmentDate}/

        Run an assessment again. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. If the user is not a tutor: redirect to home. Otherwise: run assessment using SubmissionManager.runAssessment(String, String, String)

        Parameters:
        username - the user which you want to download the submission for
        assessmentName - the short name (no whitespace) of the assessment
        assessmentDate - the date (format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH-mm-ss)
        model - the model being used
        request - the http request being used for redirecting.
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "redirect:/home/" or redirect back to the referrer

      • giveExtension

        @RequestMapping(value="student/{username}/extension/{assessmentName}/{extension}/")
public java.lang.String giveExtension(@PathVariable(value="username")
                                            java.lang.String username,
                                            @PathVariable(value="assessmentName")
                                            java.lang.String assessmentName,
                                            @PathVariable(value="extension")
                                            java.lang.String extension,
                                            org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        $PASTAUrl$/student/{username}/extension/{assessmentName}/{extension}/

        Give an extension to a user for an assessment. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. If the user is not a tutor: redirect to home. If the user is an instructor: give the extension using UserManager.giveExtension(String, String, Date) then redirect to the referrer page.

        Parameters:
        username - the user which you want to download the submission for
        assessmentName - the short name (no whitespace) of the assessment
        extension - the date (format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH-mm-ss)
        model - the model being used
        request - the request begin used to redirect back to the referer.
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "redirect:/home/" or redirect back to the referrer

      • handMarkAssessment

        @RequestMapping(value="mark/{username}/{assessmentName}/{assessmentDate}/")
public java.lang.String handMarkAssessment(@PathVariable(value="username")
                                                 java.lang.String username,
                                                 @PathVariable(value="assessmentName")
                                                 java.lang.String assessmentName,
                                                 @PathVariable(value="assessmentDate")
                                                 java.lang.String assessmentDate,
                                                 org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        $PASTAUrl$/mark/{username}/{assessmentName}/{assessmentDate}/

        Mark the submission for a student. If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. If the user is not a tutor: redirect to home. ATTRIBUTES:

        unikeyPASTAUser the user logged in
        studentPASTAUser the user being viewed
        assessmentNamethe short name(no whitespace) of the assessment
        nodeThe root FileTreeNode for the root of the submitted code
        assessmentResultThe AssessmentResult for this assessment
        handMarkingListThe list of WeightedHandMarking
        JSP:
        • assessment/mark/handMark
        Parameters:
        username - the user which you want to download the submission for
        assessmentName - the short name (no whitespace) of the assessment
        assessmentDate - the date (format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH-mm-ss)
        model - the model being used
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "redirect:/home/" or "assessment/mark/handMark"

      • saveHandMarkAssessment

        @RequestMapping(value="mark/{username}/{assessmentName}/{assessmentDate}/",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String saveHandMarkAssessment(@PathVariable(value="username")
                                                     java.lang.String username,
                                                     @PathVariable(value="assessmentName")
                                                     java.lang.String assessmentName,
                                                     @PathVariable(value="assessmentDate")
                                                     java.lang.String assessmentDate,
                                                     @ModelAttribute(value="assessmentResult")
                                                     AssessmentResult form,
                                                     org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result,
                                                     org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        $PASTAUrl$/mark/{username}/{assessmentName}/{assessmentDate}/ - POST

        Save the hand marking for a submission for a student If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. If the user is not a tutor: redirect to home. Otherwise: update the hand marking results and comments using HandMarkingManager.saveHandMarkingResults(String, String, String, List) and HandMarkingManager.saveComment(String, String, String, String)

        Parameters:
        username - the user which you want to download the submission for
        assessmentName - the short name (no whitespace) of the assessment
        assessmentDate - the date (format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH-mm-ss)
        form - the assessment result object
        result - the binding result used for feedback
        model - the model being used
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "redirect:/home/" or "redirect:/mirror/"

      • handMarkAssessmentBatch

        @RequestMapping(value="mark/{assessmentName}/{studentIndex}/",
                method={POST,GET})
public java.lang.String handMarkAssessmentBatch(@PathVariable(value="studentIndex")
                                                      java.lang.String studentIndex,
                                                      @PathVariable(value="assessmentName")
                                                      java.lang.String assessmentName,
                                                      @RequestParam(value="student",required=false)
                                                      java.lang.String student,
                                                      @ModelAttribute(value="assessmentResult")
                                                      AssessmentResult form,
                                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                      org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        $PASTAUrl$/mark/{assessmentName}/{studentIndex}/ - POST and GET

        Used for the batch marking of the students in your class(es). If the user has not authenticated: redirect to login. If the user is not a tutor: redirect to home. POST: Save the AssessmentResult form for the last user you marked using HandMarkingManager.saveHandMarkingResults(String, String, String, List) and HandMarkingManager.saveComment(String, String, String, String) GET: Takes you to the hand marking template(s) to the user. If the studentIndex is pointing to a student that has no submissions, go to the next one. If the index is past the end of the array, go back to home. ATTRIBUTES:

        unikeyPASTAUser of the user logged in
        assessmentNamethe short name (no whitespace) of the assessment
        studentPASTAUser of the student being viewed
        nodeThe root FileTreeNode of the submitted files
        assessmentResultThe AssessmentResult for this assessment
        handMarkingListThe list of WeightedHandMarking
        savingStudentIndexA string representation of the index of the student you are saving
        hasSubmissionFlag to say whether the current student has a submission
        completedMarkingFlag to say whether the marking is complete for this student
        myStudentsThe list of PASTAUser of the users that belong in your class(es)
        JSP:
        • assessment/mark/handMarkBatch
        Parameters:
        studentIndex - the index of the student being viewed
        assessmentName - the short name (no whitespace) of the assessment
        student - the student that you have just marked and is getting saved
        form - the assessment result form to be saved
        request - the http request that's not being used
        model - the model being used
        Returns:
        "redirect:/login/" or "redirect:/home/" or "assessment/mark/handMarkBatch"

      • viewGradeCentreData

        @RequestMapping(value="gradeCentre/DATA/")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String viewGradeCentreData()
        $PASTAUrl$/gradeCentre/DATA/

        Serves up the JSON data container for the grade center. If the user has not authenticated or is not a tutor: return nothing. Otherwise use generateJSON(PASTAUser[]) for all users.

        Returns:
        the appropriate json file

      • viewStreamData

        @RequestMapping(value="stream/{streamName}/DATA/")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String viewStreamData(@PathVariable(value="streamName")
                                                          java.lang.String streamName)
        $PASTAUrl$/stream/{streamName}/DATA/

        Serves up the JSON data container for the grade center for a stream. If the user has not authenticated or is not a tutor: return nothing. Otherwise use generateJSON(PASTAUser[]) for all users in the given stream. Return nothing if the stream doesn't exist.

        Returns:
        the appropriate json file

      • viewTutorialData

        @RequestMapping(value="tutorial/{className}/DATA/")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String viewTutorialData(@PathVariable(value="className")
                                                            java.lang.String className)
        $PASTAUrl$/tutorial/{className}/DATA/

        Serves up the JSON data container for the grade center for a tutorial class. If the user has not authenticated or is not a tutor: return nothing. Otherwise use generateJSON(PASTAUser[]) for all users in the given tutorial class. Return nothing if the tutorial class doesn't exist.

        Returns:
        the appropriate json file

      • viewMyTutorialData

        @RequestMapping(value="myTutorials/DATA/")
@ResponseBody
public java.lang.String viewMyTutorialData()
        $PASTAUrl$/myTutorial/DATA/

        Serves up the JSON data container for the grade center for the user's tutorial class. If the user has not authenticated or is not a tutor: return nothing. Otherwise use generateJSON(PASTAUser[]) for all users in the user's tutorial class.

        Returns:
        the appropriate json file

      • generateJSON

        private java.lang.String generateJSON(PASTAUser[] allUsers)
        Generate the JSON

        format: 

        {
        "data": 
        [
                {
                        "name": "$username$",
                        "stream": "$stream$",
                        "class": "$class$",
                        "$assessmentName$": {
                                "mark": "######.###",
                                "percentage": "double",
                                "assessmentname": "$assessmentName$"
                        },
                        ...
                        "$assessmentName$": {
                                "mark": "######.###",
                                "percentage": "double",
                                "assessmentname": "$assessmentName$"
                        }
                },
                ...
                {
                        "name": "$username$",
                        "stream": "$stream$",
                        "class": "$class$",
                        "$assessmentName$": {
                                "mark": "######.###",
                                "percentage": "double",
                                "assessmentname": "$assessmentName$"
                        },
                        ...
                        "$assessmentName$": {
                                "mark": "######.###",
                                "percentage": "double",
                                "assessmentname": "$assessmentName$"
                        }
                }
        ]
}
        If there is no submission, mark and percentage will be "". Percentage is [1.0,0.0]. Mark is displayed to 3 decimal places.
        Parameters:
        allUsers - the users for which to generate the JSON
        Returns:
        the JSON string
